boat.full_description:
Tom Tit was built as a show piece for a yacht painter and decorator, Ernest Cave, of Itchen Ferry near Southampton. She was probably designed by Alfred Payne. As far as is known she has always been varnished. She was restored during the 1990s using original materials throughout including cotton sails and all hemp rope. She has no engine or electrics, only an emergency outboard.

She was voted by Classic Boat as no 2 of the worlds 200 best classic boats and had attended regattas in Saint Tropez, Risor, Switzerland, Douarnenez, and Flensberg.
boat.name: Tom Tit
boat.short_description: Built at Fay's Yard, but built by Cave, Yachting World (1894) describes her as an Itchen Ferry Yacht.
